front.title: MIP Extension for Ethernet Service transport Support

abstract.t: The IP Mobility Protocol [RFC3344] enables a mobile node maintain IP connectivity when it changes its location. However, it is not enough to enable the node to maintain L2 connectivity between mobile node and Ethernet service provider in order to support Ethernet service transport. This document describes "Ethernet Service Transport" mobility option for mobile IPv4 that is intended to assist home agent tunnel Ethernet packets from the home link to the FA on the foreign link during the datagram delivery process.
